byline.contributor: Alissa Rubin reported from Paris, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Mohammed Ali Kalfood contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Saudi Arabian Foreign Min Adel al-Jubeir says bombing campaign in Yemen will stop and cease-fire will be observed for five days, but stresses success will depend on cooperation on part of Houthis; cease-fire is indication that Saudis are bowing to international pressure regarding humanitarian crisis in country and amount of civilian casualties that bombings have caused.
lead_paragraph: The Saudi foreign minister said the five-day cease-fire could be renewed, and called upon Houthi rebels to “come to their senses.”

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Announces Cease-Fire in Yemen
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia Says It Will Put Yemen Cease-Fire Into Effect

snippet: The Saudi foreign minister said the five-day cease-fire could be renewed, and called upon Houthi rebels to “come to their senses.”
